messages.title: Demand better for our public services
messages.content: The chaos of Brexit means our vital public services are being ignored. The NHS is in crisis with operations cancelled and long waits to see a GP. Boris Johnson’s shameful attempts at a hard-deal Brexit mean that our schools and hospitals are suffering. “I want to stop Brexit so we can focus on what matters – better funding for public services and tackling the climate emergency,” says Liberal Democrat candidate, Matt Sanders.

messages.title: Former Labour MPs turn to Jo Swinson’s Lib Dems
messages.content: Labour have let us down on Brexit. Jeremy Corbyn’s weak leadership will only mean more chaos. MPs like Chuka Umunna and Luciana Berger have given up on Jeremy Corbyn and joined Jo Swinson’s Liberal Democrats to stop Brexit.

messages.title: You can help stop the Brexit chaos.
Who will stop Brexit here in Hampstead and Kilburn? Jo Swinson’s Liberal Democrats or Jeremy Corbyn’s Labour?
messages.content: At the next general election, voters will choose the kind of country we want to be. We can defeat nationalism and populism. We can change our politics, stop Brexit and win a brighter future.

messages.title: It’s Jeremy Corbyn’s Labour candidate or Liberal Democrat Matt Sanders here!
messages.content: The next general election here in Hampstead and Kilburn will be a simple choice between Matt Sanders and Jeremy Corbyn’s Labour. The Conservatives finished LAST at the most recent elections here and can’t win. Even local Tories are backing the Liberal Democrats. Labour are divided and Jeremy Corbyn only offers more chaos and weak leadership. He failed to take a stance on Brexit and even his own MPs have no idea what he wants.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: I want to stop Brexit so we can focus on what matters – better funding for public services and tackling the climate emergency.

community.content: Boris Johnson’s shameful attempts at a hard-deal Brexit mean that our schools and hospitals are suffering.

endorsements.endorsement: The failure of the motion to back remaining in the EU at Labour’s conference confirms what we knew. The Labour party is not a Remain party but are sitting on the biggest issue facing the UK since WWII, faced by a Brexiter.

quotes.text: The failure of the motion to back remaining in the EU at Labour’s conference confirms what we knew. The Labour party is not a Remain party but are sitting on the biggest issue facing the UK since WWII, faced by a Brexiter.
At the next general election, voters will choose the kind of country we want to be. We can defeat nationalism and populism. We can change our politics, stop Brexit and win a brighter future.
There is renewed confusion over Jeremy Corbyn’s Brexit position after the suggestion he’d remain neutral in any new EU referendum.
The Labour leader declined to clarify whether he would back Remain or Leave in a Brexit referendum if he were prime minister.
The Lib Dems won handsomely in nearly all the wards across the constituency in May’s European Parliament vote. They have pledged to end Brexit.

Jeremy Corbyn’s weak leadership will only mean more chaos.
